posts.name: Abhi Patil
posts.cooked: I’m using team 364’s swerve code ( GitHub - Team364/BaseFalconSwerve ) with an SDS mk4 L2 swerve drivetrain. My team has a Navx, so I want to know how to use it instead of the pigeon gyro used in the code.

posts.name: Reza
posts.cooked: Modify the Swerve.java class and change everything that has to do with the Pigeon to the NavX. This includes the getYaw() method and everything else that mentions the gyro.

posts.name: vargoose84
posts.cooked:
In the file below look at lines 27-28 and modify to fit the NAVX code.

Also, take a look at the example code (on the right) for how to “bring up” a navx gyro

Example source code for various navX-sensor capabilities are available for both for FRC and FTC Robotics Control Systems. FRC Examples This section provides example code for several common n…

posts.name: Reza
posts.cooked: You’re going to need to change more than just those lines but ye. The second link is really good.

posts.name: Michael DeVinney
Allison Conrad
posts.cooked: This looks super promising, have you/ @Redfalcon5 tried this change on a bot yet?

posts.name: Michael DeVinney
posts.cooked: We successfully implemented these changes on a version of 364’s code, that 3512 reconfigured to use with neos. GitHub - frc3512/SwerveBot-2022: The source code for the 2022 FRC postseason swerve drive robot.

posts.name: Co-Head Mentor 3658
posts.cooked: My team just built the 2910 Mini Swerve and finished that build yesterday! Thanks to 2910 for the CAD and inspiration! We are also using Mk3 swerve modules and the BaseFalconSwerve code base from 364 so thank you Team 364. If someone would like to look over our changes to the code base to implement the NavX and changes needed to identify the Mk3’s we would be most appreciated. GitHub - github3658/BaseFalconServe

posts.name: Co-Head Mentor 3658
posts.cooked: We have yet to set up the RoboRio or download any code to the chassis.

posts.name: Circuit Serpents
posts.cooked: Team 6060 here. We used Team 364’s swerve code and implemented the Navx from Kauai labs as instructed. However, its a bit difficult on our part since this is our first time to do a swerve drive code and we are not sure if we are doing it correctly. Our concern right now is that the Navx code seems to be short which we are not sure if that is suppose to happen. Could anyone post an example of the code?
hello, ı get this error, when i build vendor navx lib. how can i fix it?

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked: What kind of network are you connected to? Does it occur if you do it at home? Can you get to that address in a web browser?
